basics.name: Yuyang Wu
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: Graduate student at Carnegie Mellon University focusing on the intersection of artificial intelligence, computational chemistry, and natural language processing. Developing AI systems to enhance trustworthiness and reliability in scientific applications.

work.name: Carnegie Mellon University
work.summary: Conducting research on improving trustworthiness of large language models in chemistry and developing large-scale quantum chemistry datasets.
highlights: Led MolErr2Fix benchmark project for evaluating LLM trustworthiness in chemistry
Collaborated with Isayev and CLAW research groups

education.institution: Carnegie Mellon University, School of Computer Science
National University of Singapore, School of Computing

publications.name: MolErr2Fix: Benchmarking LLM Trustworthiness in Chemistry via Modular Error Detection, Localization, Explanation, and Revision
publications.summary: Developed comprehensive benchmark for evaluating large language models' trustworthiness in chemistry through modular error detection, localization, explanation, and revision tasks.

publications.name: HimGNN: Hierarchical Molecular Graph Representation Learning Framework for Property Prediction
publications.summary: Designed hierarchical GNN with atom- and motif-level features and Transformer-based local augmentation module, improving performance across 8 benchmark datasets.

publications.name: Multi-View Representation Learning for Identification of Novel Cancer Genes and Their Causative Biological Mechanisms
publications.summary: Integrated multi-omics data (genomic, transcriptomic, epigenomic, PPI) to identify 74 high-confidence candidate cancer genes.

projects.name: CHEM-AL: Active Learning for Molecular Property Prediction
projects.summary: Built active learning framework with uncertainty, QBC, and diversity sampling. Implemented Naïve Bayes and MLP (with MC Dropout) on MoleculeNet datasets.
highlights: Achieved 50% reduction in labeling requirements versus random sampling

projects.name: Computational Prediction of Protein–Protein Interactions (PPI)
projects.summary: Designed deep learning pipelines for SHS27K benchmark (16,912 interactions). Developed ProBERT-BiGRU-Attention and Transformer-based models.
highlights: Built GNN capturing structural context for unseen proteins

projects.name: Large-Scale Multi-Property Quantum Chemistry Dataset
projects.summary: Created a multi-million-entry dataset including energies, forces, dipoles, quadrupoles. Benchmarked SchNet, PaiNN, E2GNN, Equiformer for molecular property prediction.
highlights: Preparing publication and open dataset release
